subject: Relationships
title: Divorce Law: From Impossible to No-Fault
description: A 60-second lesson on Divorce Law: From Impossible to No-Fault.

hook.text: Until 1857, getting a divorce in England required an act of Parliament. Only four women managed it in 200 years.

buildup.text: For centuries, divorce required proof of extreme fault: adultery, cruelty, or desertion. Unhappiness wasn't enough.

discovery.text: California introduced no-fault divorce in 1970. You could end a marriage simply because you wanted to.

twist.text: Divorce rates spiked after no-fault laws â€” then dropped. People who shouldn't have married stopped marrying.

climax.text: Easy divorce didn't destroy marriage. It destroyed bad marriages â€” and freed people to find better ones.

punchline.text: No-fault divorce didn't destroy marriage. It destroyed bad ones.
